column2: I am sure many of the people who dine here are from out of town
column3: that doesn't make their food any less amazing! I was blown away by their extensive menu and the dishes we got. We arrived about 10 minutes before opening on a Wednesday
column4: and there were already people gathering. The space is beautifully lit and I loved their rustic French decor. We ordered the smoked pork tongue (my favorite)
column7: and the caviar & ice cream. Nothing disappointed.
